Organization: Defenders of Wildlife
Request Description: Requesting all documents, correspondence of any kind, internal to USDA Wildlife Services or by and between USDA Wildlife Services and/or the State of Idaho and/or other federal or state agencies referring or related to wolf predation and wolf control actions in the state of Idaho including: 1. Any wolf control activities undertaken by or with the support of Wildlife Services or the state of Idaho for the purpose of affecting game populations or hunter harvest. Any wolf control activities undertaken by or with the support of Wildlife Services or the state of Idaho for livestock depredation. Include any records of compensation claims investigated or paid. 2. For the purposes of this request, we seek records of lethal control activities since January 1, 2014 including the number of wolves and general locations of the actions (i.e. national forest or hunting districts). 3. Any and all records regarding an incident involving 176 sheep killed by wolves in the Teton Basin in August 2013. Please provide, among other documents, all records of any investigation and basis for any conclusions reached regarding this incident. 4. Records regarding a reported Swigert colt depredation in Blaine County. Records should include copies of the investigation report(s) including any photos or video taken in relation to the investigation. Records should also include specific details regarding the "one bite wound" that reportedly was attributed to a wolf attach and where on the body of the colt that this wound was documented. 5. Any and all records and correspondence related to the Idaho Wolf Control Board. This includes all communications, emails, and other documents between and among Wildlife Services Idaho state office, the Idaho Department of Fish and Game (IDFG), and the Governor of Idaho in the creation of the Wolf Control Board and its subsequent activities. Include any National Environmental Policy Act documentation, if any for Wildlife Services participation in Wolf Control Board activities. 6. Any and all records and correspondence related to Idaho House Bill 470, otherwise known as the "Wolf Kill Bill," see http://legislature.idaho.gov/l egislation/2014/H0470.htm. Include any records related to the development of the legislation, its language, and passage. 7. Any and all records of any funds received by Idaho WS from the state of Idaho or other sources for lethal wolf control outside of the Lolo District, including records of the amount spent and for what actions. 8. Any and all records regarding IDFG/Wildlife Services spending per helicopter operation. IDFG reported a recent Lolo action as costing $30,000. Include any records of Wildlife Services involvement in Lolo gunning operations including what weapons and ammunition were used.

Organization: USA Today
Request Description: Requesting access to and copies of records (paper or electronic) relating to USDA/APHIS' role enforcing federal select agent rules from Oct. 1, 2004 through the date documents are actually gathered in response to this request. The documents I'm seeking include: 1. Annual or periodic enforcement reports that include such information as disciplinary actions taken against select agent labs, including suspensions, revocations or fines/CMPs. 2. Records of each CMP/fine imposed and related records showing, how much, if any of that fine/CMP was ultimately paid and when. It would seem that there would be some sort of system for tracking CMPs from a registered entity's initial notification that they were going to face a CMP/fine to when/if the CMP/fine was paid. (Such records might include correspondence with the entity notifying them the CMP/fine has been reduced or waived, or correspondence from the entity confirming payment of the CMP/fine.) 3. Copies of letters notifying select agent entities of their suspension or termination from the select agent program; or the imposition of a CMP/fine. And copies of follow-up letters notifying the entity of their reinstatement in the select agent program.

Organization: Western Environmental Law Center
Request Description: Requesting the following documents relating to agency operations in Arizona, New Mexico and Texas: 1. Any and all memoranda of understanding, memoranda of agreement, cooperative agreements, agreements for control, annual work plans, or other type of agreement instruments or contracts signed between APHIS and private land owners for wildlife damage management that discuss, describe, or otherwise provide information regarding the location of work performed, control methods used, and targeted animals for work conducted in Gila and Pinal counties, Arizona performed between January 1, 2012 to the date of response. 2. Any and all memoranda of understanding, memoranda of agreement, cooperative agreements, agreements for control, annual work plans, or other type of agreement instruments or contracts signed between APHIS and any city, county, state, or federal agencies or agency representatives for wildlife damage management that discuss, describe, or otherwise provide information regarding the location of worked performed, control methods used, and targeted animals for work conducted in Gila and Pinal counties, Arizona performed between January 1, 2012 to date of this response. 3. A copy of the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service's August 15, 1997 Biological Opinion regarding the effects of Wildlife Services activities on the endangered ocelot and jaguarondi in South Texas. 4. All documents related to the 2005 re-initiation of consultation process between APHIS and U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service regarding the effects of Wildlife Service's activities on the jaguar, including any Biological Assessments, Biological Opinions, concurrence letters, and any other correspondence between the two agencies. 5. Any documentation or permits related to incidental or targeted ocelot trapping in Arizona, New Mexico and Texas. 6. A copy of the most recent nationwide consultation agreement between APHIS Wildlife Service and U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service. 7. The APHIS Wildlife Services 1996 Environmental Assessment and Decision Notice/Finding of No Significant Impact related to predator damage management on nonfederal and tribal lands in the Arizona animal damage control program, as well as any consultation documents (including, but not limited to Biological Assessments, Biological Opinions, and concurrence letters) sent to or received from the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service related to this Environmental Assessment and Decision Notice. 8. Any post-1996 Environmental Assessments, Decision Notices, and consultation documents (including, but not limited to Biological Assessments, Biological Opinions, and concurrence letters) prepared or received by Wildlife Services pertaining to predator damage control management on nonfederal and tribal lands in Arizona animal damage control program. 9. Any Biological Opinion received by APHIS Wildlife Services from the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service stemming from the November 2002 Biological Assessment related to potential effects of Wildlife Services activities on the southwestern willow flycatcher. etc.
